name: efcore-migration-script-generator-task
friendlyName: Entity Framework Core Migrations Script Generator
description: Tool for projects that use Entity Framework Core Code-First. Generates migration scripts which can be used to update a database (for instance with the task 'Azure SQL Database Deployment').
author: PEK's Productions

inputs.name: projectpath
inputs.label: Main Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to project (for instance a .csproj file) containing DbContexts.

inputs.name: databasecontexts
inputs.label: DbContexts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name(s) of DbContexts, one per line.

inputs.name: startupprojectpath
inputs.label: Startup Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to an executable project that references the Main Project containing your DbContext(s) (for instance a .csproj file). If the DbContext(s) are defined in the Main Project, then this setting is not necessary.

inputs.name: targetfolder
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Where migration scripts should be saved. One .sql file will be generated for each DbContext you specify, named the same as your DbContext class. For example, if your DbContext is named MyTestDbContext, then the output file will be named MyTestDbContext.sql.

inputs.name: build
inputs.label: Build project
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the projects should be built before the scripts are generated. If this is running in a build pipeline, often this could be unchecked.

inputs.name: installdependencies
inputs.label: Install dependencies for .NET Core 3 or later
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using **.NET Core 3 or later**, the global tool **dotnet-ef** needs be installed before migrations script could be generated. Check this setting to do this automatically.

inputs.name: eftoolversion
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of **dotnet-ef** to be installed. Example **3.1.14** or **5.0.5**. Leave empty for latest version.

inputs.name: nugetconfiguration
inputs.label: NuGet configuration file
inputs.helpMarkDown: NuGet configuration file to be used when dotnet-ef is installed. Not used in build. Normally not needed.

inputs.name: startMigration
inputs.label: Start migration
inputs.helpMarkDown: From which migration script should be generated. Example **AddSecondName** or **20210408185844_AddSecondName**. Leave empty for using the default '0'. Note that this will be used on all DbContexts.

inputs.name: endMigration
inputs.label: End migration
inputs.helpMarkDown: To which migration script should be generated. Example **AddThirdName** or **20210408185937_AddThirdName**. Leave empty for using the last migration. Note that this will be used on all DbContexts.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Build configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build configuration to use. For instance **Release** or **Debug**. Normally this could be empty.

inputs.name: idempotent
inputs.label: Make script idempotent
inputs.helpMarkDown: Generate a script that can be used on a database at any migration. Recommended.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run. Normally this could be empty. But if you are getting error like **Specify which project file to use**, try a different directory.
